title: What's up with matchmaking
body:
Playing flex queue with a friend in his promos for Silver 1, i am lower. We are matched against:
Diamond4 ADC and unranked this season Support (Gold 5 last season)
Plat4 Mid
Plat4 Jungle
Gold4 Top
We can't even queue with our friend in Plat because of division difference, what gives with this sort of matchmaking? On top of that our jungle apparently hadn't played jungle since season 4, inted continuously as did his duo bud in top lane. Then next game we queue and get the same guys who then tell me to "f off c" when i said i was going to dodge because i didn't want to play with them again.

Can someone from Riot please explain how this game came to be? Because it wasn't fun at all, wasn't competitive, and was in promos.
Thankyou.

replies.body:
Flex Queue MMR is different to Solo/Duo Queue MMR, they may have been your rank in Flex, but those higher ranks in Solo Queue.

Additionally, Promos is designed to be harder, how do you expect to climb (or gain any form of skill) if you play against people worse or equal to you, as for the rank difference welcome to Riot Matchmaking, enjoy your stay

It's meant to be the rank of where you are climbing to; i.e bronze promos should be against silvers etc, as that is the equivalent MMR. It's a bit of a leap friend to say that in bronze/silver promos it is appropriate to be matched against plat and diamond.

Guess you missed this,

"as for the rank difference welcome to Riot Matchmaking, enjoy your stay"

It's called satire, this is me making fun of Riot, thank you for being oblivious
No i ignored that bit and answered the parts i thought were legitimate responses from you.

I'm not from riot so you may not care what I have to say but, I can tell you when you're in promo's matchmaking will match you against about the middle ground or average difficulty of rank. Then for the 10 games of promo's it gives you the opportunity to climb higher due to the opponents mmr that you beat or alternatively, gives you a lesson in what areas you can improve on if you are not around that level of skill. 
 All you can do is play out the 10 games and go from there when you get given you're final rank.

thanks for replying. but 10 games is placements, not promos.
its also not middle rank when im bronze against plat/diamonds.
but i take your point, thanks.

Yeah sorry a few spelling mistakes. Most of Riot's systems seem really complex to me (match making, report system and damage ratio's for example) but I do wish they provided more guides to give players more of an understanding of the game. Even a proper TFT guide would be nice.
